projectGridLines.title: Multivariate Analysis for Marketing Campaign Optimisation
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Explore the application of multivariate analysis techniques, such as

multivariate regression or multivariate hypothesis testing, to analyse the interrelationships

between multiple variables in marketing campaign data. The goal is to identify complex

patterns and interactions among different campaign factors (e.g., audience

demographics, ad creatives, channel performance) to generate more comprehensive and

actionable insights for campaign optimisation.

Skill sets: Multivariate statistical techniques such as multivariate regression, principal

component analysis (PCA), or factor analysis.

Data preprocessing, dimensionality reduction, and exploratory data analysis.

Traits expectation: Strong analytical skills with a focus on understanding complex data

relationships.

Curiosity and eagerness to explore advanced statistical methodologies in marketing

analytics.

Expected learning: Gain practical experience in applying multivariate analysis

techniques to marketing campaign data.

Understand the advantages and limitations of multivariate analysis compared to single

variant analysis.

Learn about the interpretation and visualization of multivariate analysis results for

generating actionable insights.

Specific courses required for project execution: 1. Multivariate Data Analysis

2. Applied Multivariate Analysis

projectGridLines.title: Predictive Analytics for Campaign Performance Optimisation
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Develop a predictive analytics model that leverages historical marketing

data to forecast campaign performance metrics such as click-through rates, conversion

rates, and customer acquisition costs. The objective is to empower marketers with

actionable insights to optimize future campaign strategies and resource allocation.

Skill sets: Machine learning techniques such as regression, classification, and time

series analysis.

Data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.

Familiarity with tools and frameworks for data visualization and analysis (e.g., Pandas,

Matplotlib, Scikit-learn).

Traits expectation: Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights.

Creativity in exploring different modeling approaches and feature engineering techniques.

Expected learning: Gain practical experience in building predictive analytics models for

marketing applications.

Understand the importance of feature selection and model interpretation in predictive

modeling.

Learn about the challenges and considerations in deploying predictive models in a


production environment.

Specific courses required for project execution: Machine Learning for Predictive

Analytics

Applied Data Science with Python Specialisation

Time Series Forecasting
